title: Apigee - Create a cluster
abstract:
# Apigee - Create a cluster
You are currently viewing version 1.1 of the Apigee hybrid documentation. **This version is end of life.** You should upgrade to a newer version. For more information, see [Supported versions](/apigee/docs/hybrid/supported-platforms#supported-versions) .
The Apigee hybrid runtime runs in a Kubernetes cluster. Before you can begin the hybrid installation steps, you must first create a cluster.
content:
## 
 Basic cluster configuration requirements
Follow the basic configuration requirements listed in the following table for the type of hybrid installation you wish to create:
| Installation type | Description                                                           | Cluster requirements      |
|:--------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------|
| Non‑production  | A non-production configuration typically includes fewer nodes, consumes fewer resources, and runs in fewer zones or regions than a production cluster. Non-production clusters are commonly used for trial, demonstration, and development purposes. | Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) Anthos GKE |
| Production   | A production cluster can consume significant resources because it includes more nodes and larger virtual machine configurations than a non-production setup. Also, a production cluster might be hosted in multiple zones and regions worldwide.  | Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) Anthos GKE |
## 
 Creating a cluster
To create a cluster, follow the instructions provided by your Kubernetes service provider.  Be sure to follow the [basic configuration requirements](#basic-cluster-configuration-requirements) for your  installation use case.
| Kubernetes service provider | Installation instructions   |
|:-------------------------------|:----------------------------------|
| Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) | Creating a cluster    |
| Anthos GKE *     | Creating admin and user clusters |
| *Formerly called GKE On-Prem | *Formerly called GKE On-Prem  |
